postsData.name:
Indra Dhar
Indra Dhar
postsData.content:
Why ‚ÄúFake It Till You Make It‚Äù Is Not a Good Advice for Most of The Women Entrepreneurs

Can we agree on one thing? ‚ÄúFake it till you make it‚Äù is exhausting advice.

Pretending to have it all figured out, acting like you know everything, and putting on a show, it‚Äôs not just draining, it‚Äôs also unnecessary for most of the women.

If you‚Äôre a woman entrepreneur, you already have enough on your plate without adding the pressure to fake confidence.

And let me tell you something: pretending doesn‚Äôt build confidence, it builds burnout.

Here‚Äôs what works instead:

 Own what you know.

Start with your strengths. You don‚Äôt need to know everything, but what you do know? Use it.

 Be real about what you don‚Äôt.

Saying ‚ÄúI‚Äôm learning‚Äù is so much more powerful than pretending. People connect with honesty, not perfection.

 Invest in yourself.

Read, take courses, ask for help. Confidence grows with every new skill you learn, not with how well you fake it.

 Build your tribe.

Surround yourself with people who lift you up and remind you of your worth on the tough days.

When you stop pretending and start showing up as your real self, you attract the right clients, opportunities, and connections.

So here‚Äôs the truth: you don‚Äôt need to fake anything. You‚Äôre enough as you are. Every small step you take is what gets you closer to ‚Äúmaking it.‚Äù

What‚Äôs your take? Let‚Äôs talk in the comments.
postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Authenticity fosters genuine connections and growth. Lets celebrate our real journeys instead of the facade. üåü

I will never DM you and ask you for money or to pay me in crypto currency or invest in anything.

There are a lot of scammers and impersonators online right now trying to pose as influential people and slide into people‚Äôs DM‚Äôs looking to prey on naive followers.

Please be careful.

comments.commentText: Thank you to Kleopatra Bajor for letting me know that she has been contacted by someone impersonating as me on Facebook.
Kleopatra Bajor, I‚Äôm glad you dodged that one. I hope others will see this post and not fall for it.
Unfortunately, scammers are taking advantage of online platforms. Always remember to verify identities before engaging in any financial transactions. Stay vigilant!

postsData.commentAdded: Great reminder! Awareness is key in today‚Äôs digital world. Let‚Äôs protect our networks by staying vigilant and informed.

postsData.name:
Dionne Mejer
Dionne Mejer
postsData.content:
It was fun being featured in this article with two other powerhouse women!
Take a read and ask yourself, how effective is your communication internally? Then ask yourself, how well is everyone comprehending the verbiage that was delivered?

There's a vast difference between communicating and comprehending. And yes, we focus on communication skills verses learning speaking skills to help us know our audience and adjust accordingly.

It's not easy to communicate for comprehension as it required us to think about the other person and their perspective (if you haven't read To Kill a Mockingbird Lately, now might be a good time). Yes, we must know what we'll say. We must also learn how to pressure test for comprehension, otherwise, we're simply having a bunch of words dump out of our mouth.

Take a look at this article

Then register for our upcoming Workout Wednesday where you'll get an overview of my Art of Conversation workshop. If you're looking to increase your conversational effectiveness, this 30 minute will change your life. (Link in the first comments.)
postsData.commentAdded: Loved this insight! Effective communication truly hinges on comprehension. Excited to join the Workout Wednesday session! üöÄ

postsData.name:
Chris Donnelly
Chris Donnelly
postsData.content:
Success is easier to achieve than you think.

You just need to know the steps to take.

People who are stuck in a rut in their life...
They believe that success is out of their grasp.

However, success isn't ever that far away.

It's actually relatively simple.
It's just knowing what to do, and then executing.

To help you on that road,
Here are the 12 steps you need to take to win at life:

1. Take ownership of your life and your choices. 
‚Ü≥ You are in the driver's seat, no one else can replace you.

2. Show up every day, even when motivation fades. 
‚Ü≥ Success is found in the work you don't want to do.

3. Commit to self-improvement with books, courses, etc. 
‚Ü≥ Winning at life means having a hunger to learn.

4. Borrow from the brilliance of others. 
‚Ü≥ Avoid the pitfalls that others fell for by learning from them.

5. Focus on speed; follow through on ideas quickly. 
‚Ü≥ Speed is everything and the key to success in your career.

6. Enjoy the process. Success isn't a destination. Ô∏è
‚Ü≥ Think about it: what's the point if you aren't having fun?

7. Move in silence and stop announcing your goals. 
‚Ü≥ Go through periods of Monk Mode and focus on yourself.

8. Outwork your self-doubt; action dispels anxiety. 
‚Ü≥ Imposter syndrome is natural; competence builds confidence.

9. Play the long game because instant gratification is a trap. 
‚Ü≥ The average age of a millionaire is 61. It takes time to win.

10. Consider your diet and the energy it feeds you. 
‚Ü≥ It can either energise you or drain you. It's your choice.

11. Stack the small wins that build over time. 
‚Ü≥ That's how you stay motivated in the long term.

12. Become so consistent that you are perceived as almost robotic. 
‚Ü≥ Relentless consistency and momentum will carry you.

Remember this:
You can do it. You are capable!

Don't let your own self-narrative ruin your journey.

Which step is your favourite?
Let me know in the comments ‚¨áÔ∏è

Ô∏è Repost this to support your network's journey.
And followfor more!

If you enjoyed this content, you might like my newsletter, Step by Step:



I have 30+ free learning resources for you.
postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! üöÄ I love step 3‚Äîcommitting to self-improvement truly fuels growth. Excited to implement these strategies! #LifelongLearning

Engelbert Yene Yene
postsData.content:
Ever Wondered Why Some People Succeed Despite a Tough Past?

Let me tell you about the twins from Detroit.

‚ÄçSame family.
Same house.
Same struggles.

But one ends up in jail, and the other becomes a Fortune 500 executive.

Here‚Äôs the kicker:
They both gave the same reason for their outcome.

"What else did you expect? I grew up in a house like this."

It‚Äôs all about mindset.

Your past doesn‚Äôt have to decide your future.

Your choices, perspective, and response do.

Take this as your sign: Whatever you‚Äôre facing, you can change your story.

What‚Äôs one choice you‚Äôre making today to shape your future?

Let me know below.
postsData.commentAdded: Amazing perspective! Its so true that our mindset shapes our paths. What a powerful reminder to take control of our futures. What choice are you making today?

postsData.name:
Manoj Kondreddygari
Manoj Kondreddygari
postsData.content:
Mastering Cold Emails with HubSpot and Superhuman
Continuing from my last post on cold emailing‚Äîtracking follow-ups can be overwhelming. Sending five emails daily means over 200 emails monthly, including follow-ups. Here‚Äôs how I simplify this:

 My Streamlined Workflow

1. Sync HubSpot and Superhuman Superhuman Business Plan (or Gmail/Outlook with HubSpot extension) ensures seamless email activity tracking.

2. Automate Data with Skrapp and HubSpot CRM Skrapp saves prospect info directly to HubSpot, syncing all details with Superhuman for easy access during outreach.

3. Auto-BCC for Email Tracking I BCC HubSpot on every cold email, enabling activity tracking like sends, opens, and replies.

4. Use CRM Tasks for Follow-Ups HubSpot tasks remind me to follow up, ensuring no opportunities slip through the cracks.

 Why This Works This workflow automates and organizes my outreach, turning cold emails into warm conversations.

What‚Äôs your biggest cold emailing challenge? Let‚Äôs share insights!
postsData.commentAdded: Great tips! The integration of HubSpot and Superhuman seems like a game-changer for streamlining outreach. Excited to implement these strategies!
